definition: to bestow (a reward)/to give (to an inferior)/to hand down/a reward (bestowed by a superior)/to appreciate (beauty)

sentences.english: Perhaps as it is so close to noon, you would do me the honour of having lunch with me.
sentences.chinese: 馬上就到中午了，也許你能賞臉和我一起喫午飯。

sentences.english: I am so glad you could meet me; may I take you to dinner?
sentences.chinese: 在這見到您我很榮幸，能賞臉一起去喫個飯麼？

sentences.english: Here, I've marked them out if my lord would like a look.
sentences.chinese: 這兒，我已經全部標出來了，請大人賞臉看看。

sentences.english: Lily: All right, well, if you do , save me a dance.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，去的話，賞臉請我跳支舞吧。

sentences.english: I just wondering whether I can invite you to my party this Saturday.
sentences.chinese: 我想知道您能否賞臉參加這個星期六我舉辦的聚會。

sentences.english: Can you oblige me with a waltz dance?
sentences.chinese: 你能否賞臉和我跳一支華爾茲舞呢？

sentences.english: Finally, a VIP question you, pick up your mission helicopter, you are not he.
sentences.chinese: 最後還以貴賓待你，特派直升機去接你，你又不賞臉。

sentences.english: I wonder, Signora, if, as a personal favour, you would oblige us with a private rendition?
sentences.chinese: 夫人，能否請您賞臉爲我們私下唱一段呢？

sentences.english: Can I have the pleasure of dance?
The Guardian, I note, did not favour me with an obituary.
sentences.chinese: 我發現，《衛報》都沒賞臉爲我出條訃告。
